members.name: createClassPrepareRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled ClassPrepareRequest. The new event request is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request.

members.name: createClassUnloadRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled ClassUnloadRequest. The new event request is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request.

members.name: createThreadStartRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled ThreadStartRequest. The new event request is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request.

members.name: createThreadDeathRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled ThreadDeathRequest. The new event request is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request.

members.name: createExceptionRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled ExceptionRequest. The new event request is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request. A specific exception type and its subclasses can be selected for exception events. Caught exceptions, uncaught exceptions, or both can be selected. Note, however, that at the time an exception is thrown, it is not always possible to determine whether it is truly caught. See ExceptionEvent.catchLocation() for details.

param: refType - If non-null, specifies that exceptions which are instances of refType will be reported. Note: this will include instances of sub-types. If null, all instances will be reported
notifyCaught - If true, caught exceptions will be reported.
notifyUncaught - If true, uncaught exceptions will be reported.

members.name: createMethodEntryRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled MethodEntryRequest. The new event request is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request.

members.name: createMethodExitRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled MethodExitRequest. The new event request is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request.

members.name: createMonitorContendedEnterRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled MonitorContendedEnterRequest. The new event request is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request. Not all target virtual machines support this operation. Use VirtualMachine.canRequestMonitorEvents() to determine if the operation is supported.

throws: UnsupportedOperationException - if the target VM does not support this operation.

members.name: createMonitorContendedEnteredRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled MonitorContendedEnteredRequest. The new event request is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request. Not all target virtual machines support this operation. Use VirtualMachine.canRequestMonitorEvents() to determine if the operation is supported.

throws: UnsupportedOperationException - if the target VM does not support this operation.

members.name: createMonitorWaitRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled MonitorWaitRequest. The new event request is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request. Not all target virtual machines support this operation. Use VirtualMachine.canRequestMonitorEvents() to determine if the operation is supported.

throws: UnsupportedOperationException - if the target VM does not support this operation.

members.name: createMonitorWaitedRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled MonitorWaitedRequest. The new event request is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request. Not all target virtual machines support this operation. Use VirtualMachine.canRequestMonitorEvents() to determine if the operation is supported.

throws: UnsupportedOperationException - if the target VM does not support this operation.

members.name: createStepRequest

param: thread - the thread in which to step
throws: DuplicateRequestException - if there is already a pending step request for the specified thread.
IllegalArgumentException - if the size or depth arguments contain illegal values.

members.name: createBreakpointRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled BreakpointRequest. The given Location must have a valid (that is, non-negative) code index. The new breakpoint is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Multiple breakpoints at the same location are permitted. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request.

param: location - the location of the new breakpoint.
throws: NativeMethodException - if location is within a native method.

members.name: createAccessWatchpointRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled watchpoint which watches accesses to the specified field. The new watchpoint is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Multiple watchpoints on the same field are permitted. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request. Not all target virtual machines support this operation. Use VirtualMachine.canWatchFieldAccess() to determine if the operation is supported.

throws: UnsupportedOperationException - if the target virtual machine does not support this operation.

members.name: createModificationWatchpointRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled watchpoint which watches accesses to the specified field. The new watchpoint is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Multiple watchpoints on the same field are permitted. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request. Not all target virtual machines support this operation. Use VirtualMachine.canWatchFieldModification() to determine if the operation is supported.

throws: UnsupportedOperationException - if the target virtual machine does not support this operation.

members.name: createVMDeathRequest
members.comment: Creates a new disabled VMDeathRequest. The new request is added to the list managed by this EventRequestManager. Use EventRequest.enable() to activate this event request. This request (if enabled) will cause a VMDeathEvent to be sent on termination of the target VM. A VMDeathRequest with a suspend policy of SUSPEND_ALL can be used to assure processing of incoming SUSPEND_NONE or SUSPEND_EVENT_THREAD events before VM death. If all event processing is being done in the same thread as event sets are being read, enabling the request is all that is needed since the VM will be suspended until the EventSet containing the VMDeathEvent is resumed. Not all target virtual machines support this operation. Use VirtualMachine.canRequestVMDeathEvent() to determine if the operation is supported.

throws: UnsupportedOperationException - if the target VM does not support this operation.

members.name: deleteEventRequest
deleteEventRequests
members.comment: Removes a list of EventRequests.

param: eventRequests - the list of eventRequests to remove

members.name: deleteAllBreakpoints
members.comment: Remove all breakpoints managed by this EventRequestManager.

members.name: stepRequests
members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled step requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

members.name: classPrepareRequests
members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled class prepare requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled class unload requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled thread death requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

members.name: exceptionRequests
members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled exception requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

members.name: breakpointRequests
members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled breakpoint requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

return: the list of all BreakpointRequest objects.

members.name: accessWatchpointRequests
members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled access watchpoint requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

members.name: modificationWatchpointRequests
members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled modification watchpoint requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

members.name: methodEntryRequests
members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled method entry requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

return: the list of all MethodEntryRequest objects.

members.name: methodExitRequests
members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled method exit requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

return: the list of all MethodExitRequest objects.

members.name: monitorContendedEnterRequests
members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled monitor contended enter requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

return: the list of all MonitorContendedEnterRequest objects.

members.name: monitorContendedEnteredRequests
members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled monitor contended entered requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

return: the list of all MonitorContendedEnteredRequest objects.

members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled monitor wait requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

return: the list of all MonitorWaitRequest objects.

members.name: monitorWaitedRequests
members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled monitor waited requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted.

return: the list of all MonitorWaitedRequest objects.

members.name: vmDeathRequests
members.comment: Return an unmodifiable list of the enabled and disabled VM death requests. This list is a live view of these requests and thus changes as requests are added and deleted. Note: the unsolicited VMDeathEvent does not have a corresponding request.

return: the list of all VMDeathRequest objects.

name: com.sun.jdi.request.EventRequestManager
comment: Manages the creation and deletion of EventRequests. A single implementor of this interface exists in a particular VM and is accessed through VirtualMachine.eventRequestManager()

see: EventRequest, Event, BreakpointRequest, BreakpointEvent, VirtualMachine
